item.title: Lifestyle intervention decreases urine trimethylamine N-oxide levels in prepubertal children with obesity
item.description: Objective: Early lifestyle interventions in children with obesity decrease risk of future obesity and metabolic disorders. However, the metabolic effects of such interventions are not completely characterized. Methods: We analyzed the impact of lifestyle intervention in the urine metabolome from prepubertal children. We studied 34 prepubertal children with obesity before and after a 6- month-long lifestyle intervention program. We applied a nuclear magnetic resonance approach to obtain the metabolomic profile from urine samples.
